techmeme.title: Gruve.ai, which aims to change the traditional IT consultancy model by using AI agents to improve enterprise margins, raised a $20M Series A led by Mayfield (Marina Temkin/TechCrunch)
Experts say China's hacking breakthroughs have become more secretive since laws began requiring researchers to report vulnerabilities to the government first (Jamie Tarabay/Bloomberg)
Norway's $1.8T oil fund aims to save $400M from its $2B in annual trading costs by using AI to trade more efficiently, and it has already saved nearly $100M (Financial Times)
AI tools from Google, LinkedIn, Salesforce, and others are helping job seekers sell their skills, identify new roles, and tailor résumés to different fields (Lindsay Ellis/Wall Street Journal)
Alibaba releases Qwen2.5-Omni-3B, a scaled-down 3B-parameter variant of its flagship 7B-parameter multimodal model, designed to run on consumer PCs and laptops (Carl Franzen/VentureBeat)
